alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 1:12PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Wash and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause wash and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Three Points and State Route 286 of Three Points to mile marker 28. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
